Element.Title: A dynamic home town
Element.Description: Making Centerville attractive to residents, business, and visitors is a never-ending process. An approved park renovation plan is the major item for the years 2010 –- 2013, with all 5 municipal parks receiving major improvements. We’'d like to thank the corporate sponsors of this project as well as the volunteers and organizers. We are especially pleased to announce that Smithson Park, on the western edge of our city, will be expanded to include the adjacent wetlands. A boardwalk is planned to allow minimally obtrusive access to this beautiful nature preserve.

PropertyValues.Value: Making Centerville attractive to residents, business, and visitors is a never-ending process. An approved park renovation plan is the major item for the years 2010 –- 2013, with all 5 municipal parks receiving major improvements.

Making Centerville attractive to residents, business, and visitors is a never-ending process. An approved park renovation plan is the major item for the years 2010 –- 2013, with all 5 municipal parks receiving major improvements. We'’d like to thank the corporate sponsors of this project as well as the volunteers and organizers. We are especially pleased to announce that Smithson Park, on the western edge of our city, will be expanded to include the adjacent wetlands. A boardwalk is planned to allow minimally obtrusive access to this beautiful nature preserve.

Element.Title: Renovations at Newton Square
Element.Description:
After much planning, the renovation of Newton Square has been approved. The construction schedule begins in April. Completion is planned for late October. Parts of Mulberry and Silver streets will be closed off to all traffic.

At the request of residents living in close proximity to the square, working hours for heavy equipment will finish at 6:00 pm daily except Sundays and holidays.

The City Council Committee for architecture emphasizes that the historicity of the site will be preserved with great attention to detail.

PropertyValues.Value: After much planning, the renovation of Newton Square has been approved. The construction schedule begins in April. Completion is planned for late October.

The City Council Committee for architecture emphasizes that the historicity of the site will be preserved with great attention to detail.

Element.Title: Sports for all ages
Element.Description:
No matter what your age, there is a Centerville sports club for you!

Numerous fitness clubs, fitness centers and clubs offer different ways to select an appropriate sport. (Centerville Judo Club, 21st Avenue Swim Club, Centerville Racket Club, First Step Fitness Studio, Centerville Basketball League, United Churches Softball)

Element.Title: Tuition fees may rise
Element.Description:
Most institutes of higher learning in the Centerville area will be raising their standard tuition fees. Although this is a usual occurrence, there has been unusually strong resistance among the students and community this year.

“We do this every year, I don’t see why it’s a big deal this year” said one educator, off the record.

The president of the Centerville Educational Association said that the rate increases are generally in reaction to increased costs, which vary in each institute’s case.

There is not much that students can do in this case, although the alumni association could step in if they thought that the hikes are excessive.

PropertyValues.Value: Most institutes of higher learning in the Centerville area will be raising their standard tuition fees.

Element.Title: New Business Center Opens
Element.Description: Mayor Ebberswein inaugurated the Butterfield Business Center and Tech Park on the 28th of January. The 100,000 square foot center will hold a number of offices, design and engineering firms, and consulting companies. The fully modular interior includes a large conference room and several break-out rooms adjacent it. The center’s website is…

Element.Title: Document, Copy and Mail Services Center has moved
Element.Description:
The DCM, a fixture in the downtown Miniplaza since 1987, is moving to a new address on Manfred Street, reported Director Fred Meier, in a statement to local media outlets. Meier said that the office is no longer optimally located in regard to its clientele, and that the new location will allow a broader selection of copy machines and document production options and a more convenient layout of the store’s customer area.

“Our clients will be pleased with the new options that are available to them and the quicker access to the right equipment,” said Meier. Meier said that there will be no break in service, as the new center will start operations before the old location is completely shut down.

PropertyValues.Value: The DCM, a fixture in the downtown Miniplaza since 1987, is moving to a new address on Manfred Street, reported Director Fred Meier, in a statement to local media outlets.

Element.Title: Modern painting in Centerville
Element.Description: The Centerville Art Museum present contemporary works by Gustav Meiroth, Bernhard Hasselberg, Steve Dombrowski and other artists.  The exhibition covers 12 rooms with individual themes.

Element.Title: Book Signing
Element.Description: The author of "The Lock and Two Keys" visits Centerville. Jack Newbrough, author of the best-selling novel "The Lock and Two Keys" will be in Centerville at invitation of the Michelvert Book Club on March 2.  A press conference, question-and-answer period, and signing will be held in the University Auditorium.

Element.Title: Graffiti Competition
Element.Description: Hundreds of young people will take part in a graffiti competition on Saturday. Prizes for categories will be presented including: ecology, citizenship, and modern symbolism. Garden Street will be closed off for the day and a free concert by the local medieval retro-band You Knighted will follow.

Element.Title: Exhibitions in Centerville
Element.Description:
You don’t have to leave Centerville to learn about new technologies, learn the latest market trends, or make contacts from all over the country. Below is the exhibition schedule for the Centerville Expo Center this year:

Exhibition and Trade Show Calendar:

February 23 – 25: Education and Career;
March 9 – 11: International Chocolate
April 20 – 21: International Design and Building Forum
May 18-21: Art of Centerville and the surrounding community
June 10-13: Computer World
July 8 – 9: Furniture of the Southern Hemisphere
August 25-28: Fitness and Health as a Lifestyle
September 20-22: Publishing and Print in the Internet Age

Element.Title: Manataw Valley Institute for Technology graduates 40 seniors with exception job placement results
Element.Description:
This year’s graduating class from MVIT has already encountered serious demand from the business world.

“Highly skilled tech professional are in demand in the current climate, and employers know where to come” said Phoebe Saddlin, the Enrollment Director at MVIT.

The annual job-fair at the university, to which the public is always invited, resulted in 8 of the seniors receiving offers for positions in companies throughout the region. Many of the graduates had already planned out their post-schooling steps before the event.

“Some of us have gotten multiple offers, and some have not yet decided what to do, or plan some kind of travel or transition-type of position before joining the fulltime workforce,” said Francis Bakedon, a fluid dynamics specialist.

PropertyValues.Value: This year’s graduating class from MVIT has already encountered serious demand from the business world.

Element.Title: New Nursing MS Program available
Element.Description:
Centerville University’s new program is for busy nursing professionals ready to take their career to the next level.

The program prepares nurses for leadership positions through its MSN degree in specialization in Health Care Systems Management.

Our Master of Science in Nursing program is accredited.

Curriculum

The Health Care Management (HCM) special focus of the MSN degree concentrates on the knowledge and skills needed to succeed in a variety of positions in healthcare organizations. The program educates areas of Nursing Administration, Management, Leadership, Quality Assurance, Health Promotion, Disease Prevention/Management, Integrated Delivery Systems, Managed Care Strategies, and Workforce Management.

Our MS in Nursing prepares nurses for the most challenging new roles in today's rapidly changing managed care environment. Our curriculum will prepare you to be a leader in the field of Nursing.

PropertyValues.Value: Centerville University’s new program is for busy nursing professionals ready to take their career to the next level.

Element.Title: New Care Center to Open
Element.Description:
A Care Center staffed with nurse practitioners, physical therapists, and facilities for specialized care will be opening on Maple St. in June. The Center will be part of the Manataw Care Network and serve an estimated 4000 patients per year.

The need for an outpatient care facility is clear to anyone who lives in the northern districts. Patty Burgermeister, the Coordinator for Care of MCN, said that the facility will be furnished for the needs of the local community, the demographics of which includes as large number of seniors and children.

“We’re very excited, and aside from the more convenient quality of care, we are bringing high-quality professionals and high-paying jobs to the area”. Said Burgermeister.

PropertyValues.Value: A Care Center staffed with nurse practitioners, physical therapists, and facilities for specialized care will be opening on Maple St. in June.  The Center will be part of the Manataw Care Network and serve an estimated 4000 patients per year.

Element.Title: Electronic Medical Files greatly enhance speed of care
Element.Description:
The implementation of Electronic Medical files has improved efficiency in local hospitals and clinics, as well as provided doctors with accurate information to make faster diagnoses and treatment plans. The implementation of the program was done using a software program designed to share information across a wide range of users.

There are a lot of people who need this. A rise in efficiency like this, when multiplied across tens of thousands of healthcare customers, is a huge difference maker, said Yolanda Hartzell of MercyCare.

PropertyValues.Value: The implementation of Electronic Medical files has improved efficiency in local hospitals and clinics, as well as provided doctors with accurate information to make faster diagnoses and treatment plans.

Element.Title: Restaurants and dining
Element.Description:
Chinese cuisine: Dragon Tower, Cafe Palais Royal.

American: Jack’s Steakhouse, Cajun Rapture, The Whole Hog Barbecue, Chowder House, Amish Home Cooking, The CheeseHead, Pancake Universe, Pizza by Uncle Jesse, The Serious Burger, Catfish Farm.

Waldhoff Pub: An ideal meeting place for students and professionals, the Waldhof offers Centerville’s largest assortment of beer.

The Shelby District: there are numerous cafes, bars and other venues to choose from in the artistic and historical center of Centerville.

Shopping: Centerville offers fabulous boutique and shops, supporting the shopping interests of our diverse community. The Downtown and Shelby districts offer great shopping and impressive architecture and other attractions. Centerville malls are the place to go in bad weather.

Shopping in the city center: The famous Centerville pedestrian zone on Garden Street has numerous shops and boutiques where you can buy include world-renowned brands. You will be passing by the Centerville Cathedral, City Hall and Shine Runner Street. Not far from the city center are three well-known shopping areas of Centerville: Palazzo, West Gallery and the New Arcades. These are the most popular meeting points for Centerville residents and city guests. You can not only shop but also visit many cafes, restaurants, beauty salons and cinemas.

By car or by public transport, you can quickly and easily travel between shopping districts. In the commercial building and technology you will find everything to offer the modern world of technology at all. In the furniture center, you can choose furniture for every taste and every need. The area also has the largest supermarkets in the city of Centerville.

PropertyValues.Value: Centerville has a wide selection of excellent restaurants covering a full range of tastes. New establishments, and ones that have been part of the city as long as 50 years can be found in this section.

Chinese cuisine: Dragon Tower, Cafe Palais Royal.

American: Jack’s Steakhouse, Cajun Rapture, The Whole Hog Barbecue, Chowder House, Amish Home Cooking, The CheeseHead, Pancake Universe, Pizza by Uncle Jesse, The Serious Burger, Catfish Farm.

Element.Title: Healthcare: Centerville Hospital
Element.Description:
Centerville Hospital is a full-service, 300-bed hospital with an intensive care, natal, and mental health departments. The staff and doctors are among the best specialists in the state.

Our involvement in the development of codes extends from following the Hospital Building Safety Board and its advisory role to OSHPD, as well as being a member of the health care advisory subcommittee to the Building Standards Commission representing the long term care industry. Advocating for the healthcare construction community has resulted in many successes. This includes extending the allowable distance from the nurses station to the most remote room from 90 linear feet to 150 linear feet, giving the design professional and the operators greater creativity and flexibility in the design of the facilities. With that involvement in the industry, we work to stay informed and educate others on the latest happenings in our healthcare community.

After each Health Care Community Discussion, hosts were asked to fill out a Participant Survey and submit a group report to the Health Policy Transition Team summarizing the group’s main concerns and suggestions. Committed to bringing all Americans to the table, the Health Policy Transition Team, a team of dedicated volunteers, and some employees spent thousands of hours reading and analyzing, line-by-line, the 3,276 group reports submitted to quantitative analysis. This report summarizes these Health Care Community Discussion participants’ views on the health care problems people face and the solutions they propose.

PropertyValues.Value: Centerville Hospital is a full-service, 300-bed hospital with an intensive care, natal, and mental health departments.  The staff and doctors are among the best specialists in the state.
